author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of schools and colleges participated in a rally to create awareness of sexual abuse of children, organised by Madurai chapter of Young Indians, a wing of Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), here on Sunday.

Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao, inaugurated and took part in the rally. “We organised the rally as part of project Masoom , a nationwide initiative of Young Indians,” said Poornima Venkatesh, Chairperson of the project for Madurai chapter.

She said that awareness sessions had been held so far in 21 schools since the launch of the project in last August. “It is a sensitive subject and we faced opposition in conducting the sessions even from school administration and parents,” she said.

“However, the good thing is, some of the children came forward at the sessions to speak about the abuse they had been facing,” she added.

She said that Young Indians was collaborating with ChildLine on the project across the country.
title: Rally against child abuse
